hypothesis_content.title: Negative News Stress-Test Resilience Amplifier
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL/BULL regime, when a significant negative crypto-specific news catalyst (e.g., major exchange lawsuit, regulatory crackdown) causes an initial sharp drop (≥ -4% in 2H for BTC), a volatility-driven overshoot occurs. A snap-back rally of 50-70% of the initial drop will occur within 12-24 hours if the drop does NOT break key institutional support (e.g., 200D MA, prior monthly low).
hypothesis_content.rationale: In non-bear regimes, institutional and algorithmic buyers defend key technical levels. A sharp, news-driven drop creates liquidation cascades and panic selling that overshoots fair value. The absence of a key support break suggests the core trend is intact, prompting a fast rebound as leveraged shorts cover and value buyers step in.
entry_conditions: BTC has a 2H candle close ≥4% below the prior 2H close
Catalyst: identifiable major negative headline within prior 6H
BTC price remains >2% above its 200-day SMA on the 1H close following the drop
BTC 5-min RSI (14) reaches ≤12 (extreme oversold) during the drop
Enter long on the 1H close following the RSI ≤12 signal

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 60% of the initial 2H drop (from entry price to pre-drop high)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price breaks below the 200-day SMA on a 1H close

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: In >40% of cases meeting entry conditions, price fails to retrace >40% of the initial drop before breaking the 200D SMA or 24h elapses.
